meanings.definition: To give official permission or approval for something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will authorize the students to go on a field trip.
meanings.sent2: The manager must authorize all purchases over $100.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to authorize the dog to chase its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to authorize the flowers to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The king's decree will authorize the celebration to begin.

meanings.definition: To empower or enable someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach will authorize the players to make their own decisions on the field.
meanings.sent2: The new software will authorize users to access sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The superhero authorized the sidekick to use their powers for good.
meanings.sent4: The key unlocked the door, authorizing entry into the mysterious room.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand authorized the wizard to cast powerful spells.
